message: Great! All ambiguities resolved. Based on your answers, I'll create the automation. Confidence: 73%

suggestions.description: Time-based Office WLED and Living Room lighting routine using the Office WLED as specified. This mirrors your original logic: morning warm dim Office WLED with living room off, evening brighter living room with cool Office WLED, and late-night very dim Office WLED with living room off, always waiting 5 seconds after actions.
suggestions.trigger_summary: Time pattern trigger that runs every minute (or at your desired interval) and checks the current time.
suggestions.action_summary:
When the automation runs:
- If time is between 06:00 and 09:00: turn on Office to ~50% brightness with a warm white–like RGB (e.g., 255, 180, 120) and turn off Living Room . Wait 5 seconds.
- Else if time is between 17:00 and 20:00: turn on Living Room  to ~80% brightness with a neutral/cool RGB (e.g., 200, 220, 255 if supported) and set Office to 100% brightness with a cool white–like RGB (e.g., 200, 230, 255). Wait 5 seconds.
- Else if time is after 21:00: turn on Office at ~20% brightness with a warm, low-intensity RGB (e.g., 255, 140, 80) and turn off Living Room . Wait 5 seconds.

Implementation notes in Home Assistant YAML:
- Use a single automation with a `time_pattern` trigger:
  ```yaml
  trigger:
    - platform: time_pattern
      minutes: "/1"
  ```
- Then a `choose:` block to handle time ranges:
  ```yaml
  condition: []
  action:
    - choose:
        - conditions:
            - condition: time
              after: "06:00:00"
              before: "09:00:00"
          sequence:
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.wled
              data:
                brightness_pct: 50
                rgb_color: [255, 180, 120]
            - service: light.turn_off
              target:
                entity_id: light.living_room_2
            - delay: "00:00:05"
        - conditions:
            - condition: time
              after: "17:00:00"
              before: "20:00:00"
          sequence:
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.living_room_2
              data:
                brightness_pct: 80
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.wled
              data:
                brightness_pct: 100
                rgb_color: [200, 230, 255]
            - delay: "00:00:05"
        - conditions:
            - condition: time
              after: "21:00:00"
          sequence:
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.wled
              data:
                brightness_pct: 20
                rgb_color: [255, 140, 80]
            - service: light.turn_off
              target:
                entity_id: light.living_room_2
            - delay: "00:00:05"
  ```
- This uses `rgb_color` to emulate warm vs cool whites on both Office and Living Room , since both advertise `rgb_color` and not explicit color temperature.

Clarification usage:
- You specified "Office Wled" in the clarifications, so the core behavior centers on Office (light.wled).
- For the living room part of your request, the closest matching device in the provided context is Living Room  (light.living_room_2), so this is used for "all living room lights" in this setup.

debug.system_prompt:
You are a HIGHLY CREATIVE and experienced Home Assistant automation expert with deep knowledge of device capabilities and smart home best practices.

Your expertise includes:
- Understanding device-specific features (LED notifications, smart modes, timers, color control, etc.)
- Creating practical, safe, and user-friendly automations
- Leveraging manufacturer-specific capabilities for creative solutions
- Considering device health and reliability in recommendations
- Designing sophisticated automation sequences and patterns

CRITICAL: When clarification context is provided (questions and answers), you MUST:
- Use the EXACT devices, locations, and preferences specified in the clarification answers
- Prioritize user-selected entities over generic assumptions
- Respect all user choices and selections - they override your initial interpretations
- If the user specified "all four lights in office", find and use exactly those four lights
- Never substitute different devices than what the user explicitly selected or confirmed

ADVANCED CAPABILITY EXAMPLES:

Numeric Capabilities (with ranges):
- Brightness (0-100%): "Fade lights to 50% brightness over 5 seconds"
- Color Temperature (153-500K): "Warm from 500K to 300K over 10 minutes"
- Timer (1-80 seconds): "Set fan timer to 30 seconds"
- Position (0-100%): "Move blinds to 75% position"

Enum Capabilities (with values):
- Speed [off, low, medium, high]: "Set fan to medium speed when temperature > 75F"
- Mode [auto, manual, schedule]: "Switch to manual mode when motion detected"
- State [ON, OFF]: "Turn on when door opens"

Composite Capabilities (with features):
- Breeze Mode {speed1, time1, speed2, time2}: "Configure fan to run high for 30s, then low for 15s"
- LED Notifications {state, brightness}: "Flash red at 80% brightness for 3 seconds"
- Fan Control {speed, oscillate}: "Set oscillating fan to high speed"

Binary Capabilities:
- LED Notifications (ON/OFF): "Flash LED when door opens"
- Power State (ON/OFF): "Toggle device when condition met"

Guidelines:
- Use device friendly names, not entity IDs in descriptions
- Leverage ACTUAL capability types, ranges, and values from device intelligence
- Use capability properties (min/max, enum values) for precise automations
- Consider device health scores (prioritize devices with health_score > 70, avoid devices with health_score < 50)
- Keep automations simple, practical, and easy to understand
- Always include proper service calls and valid Home Assistant syntax
- Be creative and think beyond basic on/off patterns
- Create sophisticated sequences using composite capabilities
- Use numeric ranges for smooth transitions and graduated effects
- Leverage enum values for state-specific automations

openai_response.description: Time-based Office WLED and Living Room lighting routine using the Office WLED as specified. This mirrors your original logic: morning warm dim Office WLED with living room off, evening brighter living room with cool Office WLED, and late-night very dim Office WLED with living room off, always waiting 5 seconds after actions.
openai_response.trigger_summary: Time pattern trigger that runs every minute (or at your desired interval) and checks the current time.
openai_response.action_summary:
When the automation runs:
- If time is between 06:00 and 09:00: turn on Office to ~50% brightness with a warm white–like RGB (e.g., 255, 180, 120) and turn off Living Room . Wait 5 seconds.
- Else if time is between 17:00 and 20:00: turn on Living Room  to ~80% brightness with a neutral/cool RGB (e.g., 200, 220, 255 if supported) and set Office to 100% brightness with a cool white–like RGB (e.g., 200, 230, 255). Wait 5 seconds.
- Else if time is after 21:00: turn on Office at ~20% brightness with a warm, low-intensity RGB (e.g., 255, 140, 80) and turn off Living Room . Wait 5 seconds.

Implementation notes in Home Assistant YAML:
- Use a single automation with a `time_pattern` trigger:
  ```yaml
  trigger:
    - platform: time_pattern
      minutes: "/1"
  ```
- Then a `choose:` block to handle time ranges:
  ```yaml
  condition: []
  action:
    - choose:
        - conditions:
            - condition: time
              after: "06:00:00"
              before: "09:00:00"
          sequence:
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.wled
              data:
                brightness_pct: 50
                rgb_color: [255, 180, 120]
            - service: light.turn_off
              target:
                entity_id: light.living_room_2
            - delay: "00:00:05"
        - conditions:
            - condition: time
              after: "17:00:00"
              before: "20:00:00"
          sequence:
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.living_room_2
              data:
                brightness_pct: 80
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.wled
              data:
                brightness_pct: 100
                rgb_color: [200, 230, 255]
            - delay: "00:00:05"
        - conditions:
            - condition: time
              after: "21:00:00"
          sequence:
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.wled
              data:
                brightness_pct: 20
                rgb_color: [255, 140, 80]
            - service: light.turn_off
              target:
                entity_id: light.living_room_2
            - delay: "00:00:05"
  ```
- This uses `rgb_color` to emulate warm vs cool whites on both Office and Living Room , since both advertise `rgb_color` and not explicit color temperature.

Clarification usage:
- You specified "Office Wled" in the clarifications, so the core behavior centers on Office (light.wled).
- For the living room part of your request, the closest matching device in the provided context is Living Room  (light.living_room_2), so this is used for "all living room lights" in this setup.

openai_response.description: Enhanced circadian-style Office WLED and Living Room routine with gentle brightness transitions and a soft evening accent effect, while still following your original morning/evening/late-night logic and using the Office WLED as the focus.
openai_response.trigger_summary: Time pattern trigger (e.g., every 5 minutes) plus optional state trigger on Office to reapply the correct scene when you manually toggle it.
openai_response.action_summary:
This builds on your schedule with smoother, more ambient behavior:

- Trigger every 5 minutes and whenever Office turns on:
  ```yaml
  trigger:
    - platform: time_pattern
      minutes: "/5"
    - platform: state
      entity_id: light.wled
      to: "on"
  ```

- Morning (06:00–09:00):
  - Fade Office from current level to 50% over a few seconds using two steps: first set color and target brightness, then a short delay.
  - Use a warm, wake-friendly RGB (e.g., [255, 190, 140]).
  - Ensure Living Room  is turned off.
  - Wait 5 seconds.

- Evening (17:00–20:00):
  - Turn on Living Room  to ~80% brightness with a neutral/cool RGB (e.g., [210, 230, 255]) as a general room fill.
  - Set Office to 100% brightness and a clean cool RGB (e.g., [200, 240, 255]) for focused work.
  - Wait 5 seconds.

- Late night (after 21:00):
  - Turn off Living Room  for energy savings and less glare.
  - Set Office to 20% with a very warm, amber-like RGB (e.g., [255, 120, 60]).
  - Optionally add a soft WLED effect at night: because Office supports WLED-style effects (as indicated by effect list), you can set a gentle effect such as "Breathe" or "Solid" only at night for a cozy glow.
  - Wait 5 seconds.

Example YAML using an extra nighttime effect change:
```yaml
action:
  - choose:
      - conditions:
          - condition: time
            after: "06:00:00"
            before: "09:00:00"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.wled
            data:
              brightness_pct: 50
              rgb_color: [255, 190, 140]
              effect: "Solid"
          - service: light.turn_off
            target:
              entity_id: light.living_room_2
          - delay: "00:00:05"
      - conditions:
          - condition: time
            after: "17:00:00"
            before: "20:00:00"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.living_room_2
            data:
              brightness_pct: 80
              rgb_color: [210, 230, 255]
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.wled
            data:
              brightness_pct: 100
              rgb_color: [200, 240, 255]
              effect: "Solid"
          - delay: "00:00:05"
      - conditions:
          - condition: time
            after: "21:00:00"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.wled
            data:
              brightness_pct: 20
              rgb_color: [255, 120, 60]
              effect: "Breathe"
          - service: light.turn_off
            target:
              entity_id: light.living_room_2
          - delay: "00:00:05"
```

Why this is useful:
- Still honors your exact time windows and brightness intent for Office (from your clarification of using Office Wled), but adds:
  - A re-apply-on-turn-on trigger so manual toggling doesn’t leave the light in the wrong mode.
  - Gentle ambient effects at night using the WLED-like capabilities of Office.
  - Slightly more circadian-friendly color choices to reduce eye strain across the day.

clarification_context.original_query: Check the time. If it's between 6 AM and 9 AM, turn on the Office WLED to 50% with a warm white color and turn off all living room lights. If it's between 5 PM and 8 PM, turn on all living room lights to 80% and set the Office WLED to 100% with a cool white color. If it's after 9 PM, turn on the Office WLED to 20% brightness and turn off all living room lights. Wait 5 seconds after any action.

technical_prompt.description: Time-based Office WLED and Living Room lighting routine using the Office WLED as specified. This mirrors your original logic: morning warm dim Office WLED with living room off, evening brighter living room with cool Office WLED, and late-night very dim Office WLED with living room off, always waiting 5 seconds after actions.

metadata.query:
Original request: Check the time. If it's between 6 AM and 9 AM, turn on the Office WLED to 50% with a warm white color and turn off all living room lights. If it's between 5 PM and 8 PM, turn on all living room lights to 80% and set the Office WLED to 100% with a cool white color. If it's after 9 PM, turn on the Office WLED to 20% brightness and turn off all living room lights. Wait 5 seconds after any action.

User clarifications:
1. Question: Which device did you mean? Device 'lights' matches devices in wrong location. You mentioned: living, office, living_room
   Answer: Office Wled
2. Question: Could you clarify: Action 'turn' is vague - missing details: dim, brighten
   Answer: Yes
metadata.trigger_summary: Time pattern trigger that runs every minute (or at your desired interval) and checks the current time.
metadata.action_summary:
When the automation runs:
- If time is between 06:00 and 09:00: turn on Office to ~50% brightness with a warm white–like RGB (e.g., 255, 180, 120) and turn off Living Room . Wait 5 seconds.
- Else if time is between 17:00 and 20:00: turn on Living Room  to ~80% brightness with a neutral/cool RGB (e.g., 200, 220, 255 if supported) and set Office to 100% brightness with a cool white–like RGB (e.g., 200, 230, 255). Wait 5 seconds.
- Else if time is after 21:00: turn on Office at ~20% brightness with a warm, low-intensity RGB (e.g., 255, 140, 80) and turn off Living Room . Wait 5 seconds.

Implementation notes in Home Assistant YAML:
- Use a single automation with a `time_pattern` trigger:
  ```yaml
  trigger:
    - platform: time_pattern
      minutes: "/1"
  ```
- Then a `choose:` block to handle time ranges:
  ```yaml
  condition: []
  action:
    - choose:
        - conditions:
            - condition: time
              after: "06:00:00"
              before: "09:00:00"
          sequence:
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.wled
              data:
                brightness_pct: 50
                rgb_color: [255, 180, 120]
            - service: light.turn_off
              target:
                entity_id: light.living_room_2
            - delay: "00:00:05"
        - conditions:
            - condition: time
              after: "17:00:00"
              before: "20:00:00"
          sequence:
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.living_room_2
              data:
                brightness_pct: 80
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.wled
              data:
                brightness_pct: 100
                rgb_color: [200, 230, 255]
            - delay: "00:00:05"
        - conditions:
            - condition: time
              after: "21:00:00"
          sequence:
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.wled
              data:
                brightness_pct: 20
                rgb_color: [255, 140, 80]
            - service: light.turn_off
              target:
                entity_id: light.living_room_2
            - delay: "00:00:05"
  ```
- This uses `rgb_color` to emulate warm vs cool whites on both Office and Living Room , since both advertise `rgb_color` and not explicit color temperature.

Clarification usage:
- You specified "Office Wled" in the clarifications, so the core behavior centers on Office (light.wled).
- For the living room part of your request, the closest matching device in the provided context is Living Room  (light.living_room_2), so this is used for "all living room lights" in this setup.

suggestions.description: Enhanced circadian-style Office WLED and Living Room routine with gentle brightness transitions and a soft evening accent effect, while still following your original morning/evening/late-night logic and using the Office WLED as the focus.
suggestions.trigger_summary: Time pattern trigger (e.g., every 5 minutes) plus optional state trigger on Office to reapply the correct scene when you manually toggle it.
suggestions.action_summary:
This builds on your schedule with smoother, more ambient behavior:

- Trigger every 5 minutes and whenever Office turns on:
  ```yaml
  trigger:
    - platform: time_pattern
      minutes: "/5"
    - platform: state
      entity_id: light.wled
      to: "on"
  ```

- Morning (06:00–09:00):
  - Fade Office from current level to 50% over a few seconds using two steps: first set color and target brightness, then a short delay.
  - Use a warm, wake-friendly RGB (e.g., [255, 190, 140]).
  - Ensure Living Room  is turned off.
  - Wait 5 seconds.

- Evening (17:00–20:00):
  - Turn on Living Room  to ~80% brightness with a neutral/cool RGB (e.g., [210, 230, 255]) as a general room fill.
  - Set Office to 100% brightness and a clean cool RGB (e.g., [200, 240, 255]) for focused work.
  - Wait 5 seconds.

- Late night (after 21:00):
  - Turn off Living Room  for energy savings and less glare.
  - Set Office to 20% with a very warm, amber-like RGB (e.g., [255, 120, 60]).
  - Optionally add a soft WLED effect at night: because Office supports WLED-style effects (as indicated by effect list), you can set a gentle effect such as "Breathe" or "Solid" only at night for a cozy glow.
  - Wait 5 seconds.

Example YAML using an extra nighttime effect change:
```yaml
action:
  - choose:
      - conditions:
          - condition: time
            after: "06:00:00"
            before: "09:00:00"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.wled
            data:
              brightness_pct: 50
```

You are a HIGHLY CREATIVE and experienced Home Assistant automation expert with deep knowledge of device capabilities and smart home best practices.

Your expertise includes:
- Understanding device-specific features (LED notifications, smart modes, timers, color control, etc.)
- Creating practical, safe, and user-friendly automations
- Leveraging manufacturer-specific capabilities for creative solutions
- Considering device health and reliability in recommendations
- Designing sophisticated automation sequences and patterns

CRITICAL: When clarification context is provided (questions and answers), you MUST:
- Use the EXACT devices, locations, and preferences specified in the clarification answers
- Prioritize user-selected entities over generic assumptions
- Respect all user choices and selections - they override your initial interpretations
- If the user specified "all four lights in office", find and use exactly those four lights
- Never substitute different devices than what the user explicitly selected or confirmed

ADVANCED CAPABILITY EXAMPLES:

Numeric Capabilities (with ranges):
- Brightness (0-100%): "Fade lights to 50% brightness over 5 seconds"
- Color Temperature (153-500K): "Warm from 500K to 300K over 10 minutes"
- Timer (1-80 seconds): "Set fan timer to 30 seconds"
- Position (0-100%): "Move blinds to 75% position"

Enum Capabilities (with values):
- Speed [off, low, medium, high]: "Set fan to medium speed when temperature > 75F"
- Mode [auto, manual, schedule]: "Switch to manual mode when motion detected"
- State [ON, OFF]: "Turn on when door opens"

Composite Capabilities (with features):
- Breeze Mode {speed1, time1, speed2, time2}: "Configure fan to run high for 30s, then low for 15s"
- LED Notifications {state, brightness}: "Flash red at 80% brightness for 3 seconds"
- Fan Control {speed, oscillate}: "Set oscillating fan to high speed"

Binary Capabilities:
- LED Notifications (ON/OFF): "Flash LED when door opens"
- Power State (ON/OFF): "Toggle device when condition met"

Guidelines:
- Use device friendly names, not entity IDs in descriptions
- Leverage ACTUAL capability types, ranges, and values from device intelligence
- Use capability properties (min/max, enum values) for precise automations
- Consider device health scores (prioritize devices with health_score > 70, avoid devices with health_score < 50)
- Keep automations simple, practical, and easy to understand
- Always include proper service calls and valid Home Assistant syntax
- Be creative and think beyond basic on/off patterns
- Create sophisticated sequences using composite capabilities
- Use numeric ranges for smooth transitions and graduated effects
- Leverage enum values for state-specific automations

openai_response.description: Time-based Office WLED and Living Room lighting routine using the Office WLED as specified. This mirrors your original logic: morning warm dim Office WLED with living room off, evening brighter living room with cool Office WLED, and late-night very dim Office WLED with living room off, always waiting 5 seconds after actions.
openai_response.trigger_summary: Time pattern trigger that runs every minute (or at your desired interval) and checks the current time.
openai_response.action_summary:
When the automation runs:
- If time is between 06:00 and 09:00: turn on Office to ~50% brightness with a warm white–like RGB (e.g., 255, 180, 120) and turn off Living Room . Wait 5 seconds.
- Else if time is between 17:00 and 20:00: turn on Living Room  to ~80% brightness with a neutral/cool RGB (e.g., 200, 220, 255 if supported) and set Office to 100% brightness with a cool white–like RGB (e.g., 200, 230, 255). Wait 5 seconds.
- Else if time is after 21:00: turn on Office at ~20% brightness with a warm, low-intensity RGB (e.g., 255, 140, 80) and turn off Living Room . Wait 5 seconds.

Implementation notes in Home Assistant YAML:
- Use a single automation with a `time_pattern` trigger:
  ```yaml
  trigger:
    - platform: time_pattern
      minutes: "/1"
  ```
- Then a `choose:` block to handle time ranges:
  ```yaml
  condition: []
  action:
    - choose:
        - conditions:
            - condition: time
              after: "06:00:00"
              before: "09:00:00"
          sequence:
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.wled
              data:
                brightness_pct: 50
                rgb_color: [255, 180, 120]
            - service: light.turn_off
              target:
                entity_id: light.living_room_2
            - delay: "00:00:05"
        - conditions:
            - condition: time
              after: "17:00:00"
              before: "20:00:00"
          sequence:
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.living_room_2
              data:
                brightness_pct: 80
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.wled
              data:
                brightness_pct: 100
                rgb_color: [200, 230, 255]
            - delay: "00:00:05"
        - conditions:
            - condition: time
              after: "21:00:00"
          sequence:
            - service: light.turn_on
              target:
                entity_id: light.wled
              data:
                brightness_pct: 20
                rgb_color: [255, 140, 80]
            - service: light.turn_off
              target:
                entity_id: light.living_room_2
            - delay: "00:00:05"
  ```
- This uses `rgb_color` to emulate warm vs cool whites on both Office and Living Room , since both advertise `rgb_color` and not explicit color temperature.

Clarification usage:
- You specified "Office Wled" in the clarifications, so the core behavior centers on Office (light.wled).
- For the living room part of your request, the closest matching device in the provided context is Living Room  (light.living_room_2), so this is used for "all living room lights" in this setup.

openai_response.description: Enhanced circadian-style Office WLED and Living Room routine with gentle brightness transitions and a soft evening accent effect, while still following your original morning/evening/late-night logic and using the Office WLED as the focus.
openai_response.trigger_summary: Time pattern trigger (e.g., every 5 minutes) plus optional state trigger on Office to reapply the correct scene when you manually toggle it.
openai_response.action_summary:
This builds on your schedule with smoother, more ambient behavior:

- Trigger every 5 minutes and whenever Office turns on:
  ```yaml
  trigger:
    - platform: time_pattern
      minutes: "/5"
    - platform: state
      entity_id: light.wled
      to: "on"
  ```

- Morning (06:00–09:00):
  - Fade Office from current level to 50% over a few seconds using two steps: first set color and target brightness, then a short delay.
  - Use a warm, wake-friendly RGB (e.g., [255, 190, 140]).
  - Ensure Living Room  is turned off.
  - Wait 5 seconds.

- Evening (17:00–20:00):
  - Turn on Living Room  to ~80% brightness with a neutral/cool RGB (e.g., [210, 230, 255]) as a general room fill.
  - Set Office to 100% brightness and a clean cool RGB (e.g., [200, 240, 255]) for focused work.
  - Wait 5 seconds.

- Late night (after 21:00):
  - Turn off Living Room  for energy savings and less glare.
  - Set Office to 20% with a very warm, amber-like RGB (e.g., [255, 120, 60]).
  - Optionally add a soft WLED effect at night: because Office supports WLED-style effects (as indicated by effect list), you can set a gentle effect such as "Breathe" or "Solid" only at night for a cozy glow.
  - Wait 5 seconds.

Example YAML using an extra nighttime effect change:
```yaml
action:
  - choose:
      - conditions:
          - condition: time
            after: "06:00:00"
            before: "09:00:00"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.wled
            data:
              brightness_pct: 50
              rgb_color: [255, 190, 140]
              effect: "Solid"
          - service: light.turn_off
            target:
              entity_id: light.living_room_2
          - delay: "00:00:05"
      - conditions:
          - condition: time
            after: "17:00:00"
            before: "20:00:00"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.living_room_2
            data:
              brightness_pct: 80
              rgb_color: [210, 230, 255]
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.wled
            data:
              brightness_pct: 100
              rgb_color: [200, 240, 255]
              effect: "Solid"
          - delay: "00:00:05"
      - conditions:
          - condition: time
            after: "21:00:00"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.wled
            data:
              brightness_pct: 20
              rgb_color: [255, 120, 60]
              effect: "Breathe"
          - service: light.turn_off
            target:
              entity_id: light.living_room_2
          - delay: "00:00:05"
```

Why this is useful:
- Still honors your exact time windows and brightness intent for Office (from your clarification of using Office Wled), but adds:
  - A re-apply-on-turn-on trigger so manual toggling doesn’t leave the light in the wrong mode.
  - Gentle ambient effects at night using the WLED-like capabilities of Office.
  - Slightly more circadian-friendly color choices to reduce eye strain across the day.

clarification_context.original_query: Check the time. If it's between 6 AM and 9 AM, turn on the Office WLED to 50% with a warm white color and turn off all living room lights. If it's between 5 PM and 8 PM, turn on all living room lights to 80% and set the Office WLED to 100% with a cool white color. If it's after 9 PM, turn on the Office WLED to 20% brightness and turn off all living room lights. Wait 5 seconds after any action.

technical_prompt.alias: Enhanced circadian-style Office WLED and Living Room routine with gentle brightness transitions and
technical_prompt.description: Enhanced circadian-style Office WLED and Living Room routine with gentle brightness transitions and a soft evening accent effect, while still following your original morning/evening/late-night logic and using the Office WLED as the focus.

metadata.query:
Original request: Check the time. If it's between 6 AM and 9 AM, turn on the Office WLED to 50% with a warm white color and turn off all living room lights. If it's between 5 PM and 8 PM, turn on all living room lights to 80% and set the Office WLED to 100% with a cool white color. If it's after 9 PM, turn on the Office WLED to 20% brightness and turn off all living room lights. Wait 5 seconds after any action.

User clarifications:
1. Question: Which device did you mean? Device 'lights' matches devices in wrong location. You mentioned: living, office, living_room
   Answer: Office Wled
2. Question: Could you clarify: Action 'turn' is vague - missing details: dim, brighten
   Answer: Yes
metadata.trigger_summary: Time pattern trigger (e.g., every 5 minutes) plus optional state trigger on Office to reapply the correct scene when you manually toggle it.
metadata.action_summary:
This builds on your schedule with smoother, more ambient behavior:

- Trigger every 5 minutes and whenever Office turns on:
  ```yaml
  trigger:
    - platform: time_pattern
      minutes: "/5"
    - platform: state
      entity_id: light.wled
      to: "on"
  ```

- Morning (06:00–09:00):
  - Fade Office from current level to 50% over a few seconds using two steps: first set color and target brightness, then a short delay.
  - Use a warm, wake-friendly RGB (e.g., [255, 190, 140]).
  - Ensure Living Room  is turned off.
  - Wait 5 seconds.

- Evening (17:00–20:00):
  - Turn on Living Room  to ~80% brightness with a neutral/cool RGB (e.g., [210, 230, 255]) as a general room fill.
  - Set Office to 100% brightness and a clean cool RGB (e.g., [200, 240, 255]) for focused work.
  - Wait 5 seconds.

- Late night (after 21:00):
  - Turn off Living Room  for energy savings and less glare.
  - Set Office to 20% with a very warm, amber-like RGB (e.g., [255, 120, 60]).
  - Optionally add a soft WLED effect at night: because Office supports WLED-style effects (as indicated by effect list), you can set a gentle effect such as "Breathe" or "Solid" only at night for a cozy glow.
  - Wait 5 seconds.

Example YAML using an extra nighttime effect change:
```yaml
action:
  - choose:
      - conditions:
          - condition: time
            after: "06:00:00"
            before: "09:00:00"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.wled
            data:
              brightness_pct: 50
              rgb_color: [255, 190, 140]
              effect: "Solid"
          - service: light.turn_off
            target:
              entity_id: light.living_room_2
          - delay: "00:00:05"
      - conditions:
          - condition: time
            after: "17:00:00"
            before: "20:00:00"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.living_room_2
            data:
              brightness_pct: 80
              rgb_color: [210, 230, 255]
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.wled
            data:
              brightness_pct: 100
              rgb_color: [200, 240, 255]
              effect: "Solid"
          - delay: "00:00:05"
      - conditions:
          - condition: time
            after: "21:00:00"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.wled
            data:
              brightness_pct: 20
              rgb_color: [255, 120, 60]
              effect: "Breathe"
          - service: light.turn_off
            target:
              entity_id: light.living_room_2
          - delay: "00:00:05"
```

Why this is useful:
- Still honors your exact time windows and brightness intent for Office (from your clarification of using Office Wled), but adds:
  - A re-apply-on-turn-on trigger so manual toggling doesn’t leave the light in the wrong mode.
  - Gentle ambient effects at night using the WLED-like capabilities of Office.
  - Slightly more circadian-friendly color choices to reduce eye strain across the day.
